contentfulPagePressRelease.title: AEB Presents Creative Achievement and Potential and Design Excellence Awards to VCUQatar Students

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Arab Engineering Bureau presented the awards for Creative Achievement and Potential and Design Excellence to two junior and two graduating senior students from Virginia Commonwealth University in Qatar’s Graphic and Interior design departments during a ceremony held in honor of the students.

AEB’s CEO and Chief Architect Ibrahim Jaidah presented the Arab Engineering Bureau Award for Design Excellence in Graphic Design to Alanoud A Al-Attiyah, and Amani Abbarah was the recipient of the Arab Engineering Bureau Award for Design Excellence in Interior Design.

These awards, granted to outstanding graduating seniors from VCUQatar’s graphic design and interior design departments, were instituted eight years ago by Jaidah to encourage and assist graduating students start their life as designers in Qatar’s design industry.

The recently instituted Arab Engineering Bureau Award for Creative Achievement and Potential was presented to graphic design junior Ghada M Al-Suwaidi and interior design junior Noha Olivia Fahmy. These awards aim to help the junior students recognize their true potential, create leadership and encourage them to continue developing their skills through their senior year.

Besides the awards, Arab Engineering Bureau and Jaidah continue to partner with VCUQatar through their participation at Tasmeem Doha, VCUQatar’s biennial international design conference, as well as through providing internship opportunities for VCUQatar students.

For the full story, please click here.
